item.title: Pavement and kerb issue, 30th September
item.description:
The team have placed a barrier outside 119-121 mead way and closed a footpath which leads people into the road. The barriers make it difficult to get onto driveway and they have now blown over and are laying on my property. This has been the situation since the 10th September. Can this issue please be escalated and issues fixed. Closing the footpath is causing danger making people use the road when they exit the local park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin by bus st√≤p G Nightingale Place, 30th September
item.description:
The above bin has still been missed .Was reported on ref: 8159789 the bin is emptied a number of times - usually early morning on - Monday to Friday. The spillage is over the pavement and Road. Concerned this will encourage vermin , as people wait at the Bus stop, they have no place to deposit litter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Common, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Untaxed and non- MoT'd van / vehicle, 30th September
item.description:
A person who has a tenancy at 88G Herbert Road, Plumstead, London, SE18 3PP has told another neighbour that he only uses this address for his scrap business and actually lives at another address with his partner and children. He has filled the front and back garden with scrap metals, furniture and rubbish. He has now parked this untaxed Ford van at the rear of his property, which is at the front of three disabled bungalows, of which I am a tenant of one. This causes issues for ambulance access to the disabled bungalows. Since the van has been parked here, the tenant of 88G Herbert Road had filled the van with further scrap metal and damaged refrigerators. When one of the other tenants mentioned this to him, he laughed at them and continued placing items into the van.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ripon Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Tree from Russia Docks Park Hanging above Downtown Road, 30th September
item.description:
Hello, I was coming home and realised that one of the large trees at one of the entrances to Russia Docks Park has leaned above the street and looks very dangerous. I reported the issue to the concierge at Redwood Park but she told me that this is a council problem hence I am reaching out to you as someone could get hurt. Kind regards, Nikolay

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human faeces by our gate, 30th September
item.description:
A woman called Joanna (known to the police and council) has been using our bin/alley way as a toilet. There is a new pile of poo today. Someone has put some paper on top to hide it. Please can the area be cleaned? Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
